intro: Eriostemon deserti, commonly known as the desert geranium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its compact, hairy stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through features such as deep root systems and waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It blooms during the cooler months, typically between spring and early summer. Eriostemon deserti is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of the local flora in desert ecosystems.
